titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. W. A. Dowdy, J. H. Millen, George Harrold, & Al Tolbert, Jr., Indictment
CWG9181

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Todd Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } April Term 1862. Indictment
W. A. Dowdy
J H Millen
George Harrold &
Al Tolbert Jr

The grand Jury of Todd County in the name and by authority of the commonwealth of Kentucky -- accuse W A Dowdy J A Millen George Harrold and Al Tolbert Jr of the crime of robbery -- committed as follows viz. The Said W A Dowdy J H Millen George Harrold and Al Tolbert Jr on the 10" of January 1862, in the county aforesaid did willfully and feloniously and by force of arms, and violence take from the presence of& possession of Wm B. Downey several sacks of sugar and a pistol the property of said Downey, by putting Said Downey in fear of immediate injury of his person against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

J P Sullivan foreman of the Grand Jury
E, P, Campbell Comth

Witnesses
W B Downey
Martam, Campbell

A true copy
S H Perkins D, G,
For Ben T Perkins C L Cir. C

Todd Cir Ct
Commonwealth
vs } Indictment Robbery
W A. Dowdy and others
a true bill --
J P Sullivan
Foreman of the Grand Jury
150
1234
Filed April 25" 1862
Perkins ,C, T Cir, C,
No 2
Refused
